notes: XML is a portable, widely supported, open technology for data storage and exchange.
An XML parser is responsible for identifying components of XML documents and then storing those components in a data strucutre for manipulation.
An XML document that conforms to a DTD/schema is valid.
XML namespaces provided a means for document authors to prevent naming collisions.
Each namespace prefix is bound to a uniform resource identifier (URI) that uniquely identifies the namespace
To eliminate the need to place a namespace prefix in each element, authors can specify a default namespace for an element and its children.
DTDs and schemas specify documents' element types and attributes, and their relationships to one another.
A DTD expresses the set of rules for document structure using an EBNF grammar.
Schemas use XML syntax not EBNF grammar.
Two categories of types exist in XML Schema: simple types and complex types.
Every simple type defines a restriction on an XML Schema-defined schema type or on a user-defined type.
Complex types can have either simple content or complex content.
XSL transfomration is used to convert XML into any text-based document.
XSL documents have the extension .xsl.
Some XML parsers store document data as tree structures in memory called DOM tree.

sections.topic: Ajax and Ajax-enabled Rich Internet Applications
notes: Rich Internet Applications (RIAs) are web applications that approximate the look, feel and usability of desktop applications.
RIA performances comes from Ajax.
Traditional web applications are synchronous.
In an Ajax application, the requests that are made to the server is asynchronous.
When the third argument to XMLHttpRequest method open is true, the request is asynchronous.
An exception is an indication of a problem that occurs during a program's execution
try-catch block can be implemented to handle exceptions.
A callback function is registered as the event handler for the XMLHttpRequest object's readystatechange event.
Ajax applications often use XML because it consumes little bandwith and is easy to parse.
XML is used for retrieving files from a server while JSON is used whenever client interacts with a server-side web service.
